alert.note: Alert for Clay (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 13 at 11:24PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Jefferson, southwestern Stephens, southern Cotton and northeastern Clay Counties through 1215 AM CDT... At 1123 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Cookietown, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Walters, Waurika, Temple, Byers, Hastings, Addington, Sugden, Cookietown, Waurika Lake, and Taylor. This includes Interstate 44 between mile markers 9 and 21. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
